message.subject: Referendum Campaign
message.content:
M1.1. Mr. Lay--
[Conventional: salutation]
M1.2. During the negotiations with the Rockets as to how much each party would
contribute to the Arena referendum campaign, Mike Goldberg of Baker & Botts
suggested that the Rockets would like to net their contribution obligation
against other contributions that they solicited.
[Inform: Mike Goldberg's suggestion during negotiations with the Rockets]
M1.3. After a conversation with you, John Watson and I advised Mike Goldberg that
you did not want to be competing with the Rockets in soliciting
contributions to the Arena referendum campaign.
[Inform: John Watson and sender's advisement to Mike after talking to Ken Lay]
M1.4. Mike Goldberg called Friday and asked whether it would be acceptable for the
Rockets to net against their contribution obligation contributions that they
have solicited from Baker & Botts, Jim MacInvale and Tilman Fertitta.
[Inform: Mike Goldberg's request for permission on behalf of the Rockets when he called Friday]
M1.5. Mike
suggested that these three persons would be the only outside persons that
would be solicited by the Rockets.
[Inform: Mike's belief that Baker & Botts, Jim McInvale, and Tilman Fertitta are only entities that the Rockets would solicit]
M1.6. Would you please let me know if this is acceptable to you. [Y]
[Request-Information: whether the above is acceptable to Ken Lay]
Flink1.6
M1.7. You or Rosalee
may call me at 713-758-2350 or send me a response e-mail at
mtelle@velaw.com.
[Inform: Ken Lay or Rosalee can call Michael at phone number provided or email at address provided]
M1.8. Sincerely,
[Conventional: (beginning of a) signature]
